item.title: Britain Lifts Retail Crypto ETN Ban, Indicating Efforts to Become Cryptocurrency Hub
item.description: On August 6th, according to Cointelegraph's report, the UK financial regulator has removed the ban on exchange-traded notes (cETNs) for retail investors on cryptocurrency exchanges, enabling individual investors to independently assume risks and make choices on their own. This move has received industry support and is regarded as a step for the UK to align with the global crypto market and enhance its position as a hub for digital assets.Last Friday, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK announced the lifting of the ban on retail investor trading of cETNs, and the regulatory changes will come into effect on October 8th. The ban was implemented in January 2021 due to extreme market volatility and "a lack of legitimate investment need."The reversal of the cETN ban reflects a change in the regulatory agency's stance on crypto assets. A senior FCA executive stated in a release that this decision reflects the development of the market and an increased public understanding of c

item.title: Economist: U.S. Section 232 Investigation Results and Tariff Plan Will Not Be Implemented Immediately
item.description: On August 6th, as per foreign media reports, the U.S. government is on the verge of releasing the investigation results of Section 232 regarding specific industries such as global semiconductors, pharmaceutical raw materials, servers, key components, minerals, etc. Economists have pointed out that procedurally, after the investigation results are out, the U.S. President will take action within 90 days upon receiving the report. During this period, all countries have the opportunity to negotiate with the U.S. Therefore, similar to the tariff retaliation in early April, the investigation results and tariff plans of Section 232 are not anticipated to be implemented immediately. The U.S. may introduce an investment framework or structure to further negotiate U.S. investment with other countries, with conditions that might involve different durations and amounts, in exchange for a reduction in tariff rates. Regarding the semiconductor tariff rate, economists have speculated on levels rangin

item.title: Glassnode: Bitcoin Whales and Retail Investors have increased their BTC holdings over the past 15 days, which may reflect accumulation during the pullback.
item.description: On August 6th, Glassnode put out a post saying, "During the past 15 days, both whales (those holding more than 1,000 BTC) and retail investors (those holding less than 1 BTC) have been on average adding more to their holdings than they have been selling. This shows that they have been purchasing during the recent pullback. Nevertheless, this signal is lagging as it represents smoothed data over a 15-day period."

item.title: KakaoBank Plans to Enter the South Korean Stablecoin Market
item.description: On August 6th, according to The Block, Kwon Tae-hun, the CFO of KakaoBank, stated at the event for the release of the first half of 2025 performance that the bank is evaluating the issuance and custody services of digital assets and is collaborating with the stablecoin working group of the Kakao Group. KakaoBank has accumulated experience in areas such as the issuance of real-name accounts on cryptocurrency exchanges, anti-money laundering monitoring, and has participated in the pilot project of the central bank digital currency of the Bank of Korea.

item.title: SuperGaming has completed a $15 million Series B funding round, with participation from a16z Speedrun and others.
item.description: August 6th: The game development studio SuperGaming has successfully completed a Series B funding round worth $15 million. This round was led by Skycatcher and Steadview Capital, and also involved a16z Speedrun, Bandai Namco 021 Fund, Neowiz, and Polygon Ventures. As a result, the company now has a valuation of $1 billion.The newly obtained funds will be utilized to facilitate the international launch of its game "Indus Battle Royale", with Latin America being the first region. Furthermore, this funding will assist the company in expanding its game development and technology platform.

item.title: If Bitcoin surpasses $115,000, the mainstream CEX cumulative short liquidation pressure will reach 694 million.
item.description: On August 6th, based on Coinglass data, if Bitcoin surges past $115,000, the cumulative short liquidation intensity on mainstream CEX will reach $694 million.Conversely, if Bitcoin drops below $112,000, the cumulative long liquidation intensity on mainstream CEX will be $843 million.BlockBeats Note: The liquidation chart does not present the exact number of contracts to be liquidated or the precise value of the liquidated contracts. The bars on the liquidation chart actually indicate the significance of each liquidation cluster in relation to adjacent liquidation clusters, that is, the intensity.Therefore, the liquidation chart shows the extent to which the asset price reaching a certain position will be impacted. Higher "liquidation bars" signify that when the price reaches those levels, a more intense reaction will occur due to a liquidity cascade.

item.title: Analysis: If Haslet or Malpas were to take over as Federal Reserve Board members, the dollar would fall
item.description: On August 6th, based on foreign media analysis, if US President Trump selects either Kevin Hassett or David Malpass to succeed Kudlow as a Federal Reserve Board member, the US dollar is likely to weaken. This is because Hassett and Malpass are regarded as more dovish than the other top candidate for the position, Kevin Warsh. Trump is anticipated to announce by the end of this week who will replace Kudlow, and this individual is also highly likely to succeed Powell as the Fed Chair. Trump has narrowed down the candidates to four people: Hassett, Malpass, Warsh, and the current Fed Governor Waller. Regardless of whom Trump finally chooses to replace Kudlow, the candidate is prone to advocating that the Fed cut rates by more than 25 basis points in September. (FXStreet)

item.title: Tech Fairness Hackathon Successfully Concluded, with 21 Projects Winning Awards, Focusing on AI×Web3 Technology for Good
item.description: August 6: The first "Tech Fairness Hackathon" came to an end on August 4. It was co-hosted by "FAIR3", "CARV", and "HackQuest". Over 600 project registrations and more than 200 project submissions were attracted. The focus was on key issues such as technical fairness, privacy rights, and AI infrastructure. A total of 21 winning projects were selected, covering tracks like AI Infra, identity systems, and data arrangement:· The "FAIR3" track offered a $30,000 prize pool to support institutional design and public infrastructure innovation.· The "CARV" track established a $20,000 prize pool, focusing on supporting the construction of AI Agent on-chain and modular identity systems."FAIR3" simultaneously launched the "Tech Fairness Incubation Program", providing funding and community support to excellent projects and promoting developers to sign the "Technical Fairness Commitment Agreement" to jointly build an open and transparent technical future.

item.title: Analyst: If Bitcoin Tests the $105,000 Range in the Short Term, It May Have an Impact on Leveraged Futures Traders
item.description: On August 6th, CryptoQuant analyst CryptoMe stated that according to on-chain data, Bitcoin has a significant cost cluster around $105,000. This includes a UTxO wall, the average cost of 1-3 month old holdings, and the realized prices of short-term holders all concentrating at that level. The analysis pointed out that this is not a bearish signal. It is expected that Bitcoin will reach higher price levels in the medium to long term. However, if the price were to temporarily fall to this level, leveraged futures traders may face risks. It is recommended that investors appropriately reduce position risks and control volatility exposure.

item.title: Nomura Securities' subsidiary Laser Digital has been approved to launch crypto derivatives in Dubai
item.description: On August 6th, as per Coindesk, Nomura Securities' digital asset subsidiary, Laser Digital, has obtained approval to commence cryptocurrency derivatives operations in Dubai.
